paragraphs.zh-tw: 我的學生們和我致力於建造微型的機器人，你們可以將其想像為機器人版本的一種你們都很熟悉的生物，螞蟻。我們都知道，螞蟻和其它這般大小昆蟲能夠做到一些令人十分驚奇的事情
paragraphs.en: My students and Iwork on very tiny robots. Now, you can think of theseas robotic versions of something that you're allvery familiar with: an ant. We all know that antsand other insects at this size scale can do some pretty incredible things.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 比如，我們都見識過一群螞蟻或者類似的昆蟲在野餐時搬走你的薯片。但是設計這些螞蟻機器人的真正難處在哪裡呢？首先，我們如何能夠讓螞蟻大小的機器人獲得螞蟻所擁有的能力呢？我們首先需要弄清楚如何讓這麼小型的機器人動起來。
paragraphs.en: We've all seen a group of ants,or some version of that, carting off your potato chipat a picnic, for example. But what are the real challengesof engineering these ants? Well, first of all, how do we getthe capabilities of an ant in a robot at the same size scale? Well, first we need to figure outhow to make them move when they're so small.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們需要諸如腿的機械裝置以及高效的馬達來支持機器人的移動，我們還需要感應器，電源和操控系統來集中所有零部件到一個半智能的螞蟻機器人中。最後，為了讓這些零部件真正運作起來，我們希望能有大批量這樣的機器人一起協作，來完成更偉大的任務。
paragraphs.en: We need mechanisms like legsand efficient motors in order to support that locomotion, and we need the sensors,power and control in order to pull everything togetherin a semi-intelligent ant robot. And finally, to makethese things really functional, we want a lot of them working togetherin order to do bigger things.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以，我將從移動性開始講起。昆蟲擁有令人驚奇的移動能力。
paragraphs.en: So I'll start with mobility. Insects move around amazingly well.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這段影片來自加州大學伯克萊分校，展現了一隻蟑螂爬過一段相當複雜的路段，卻沒有跌倒，而牠能做到這一點是因為牠的腿由剛性材料組合而成，也就是我們傳統用於製造機器人和軟物質的材料。
paragraphs.en: This video is from UC Berkeley. It shows a cockroach movingover incredibly rough terrain without tipping over, and it's able to do this because its legsare a combination of rigid materials, which is what we traditionallyuse to make robots, and soft materials.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 而體型很小時，跳躍則是另一種十分有趣的移動方式。比如說，這些昆蟲在彈簧中儲存能量然後快速地釋放出來以獲得牠們跳出水面所需要的高能量。
paragraphs.en: Jumping is another really interesting wayto get around when you're very small. So these insects store energy in a springand release that really quickly to get the high power they needto jump out of water, for example.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 因此，我的實驗室所做出的最大的貢獻之一，就是將剛性材料和軟物質在非常小的的機械裝置中結合。這個跳躍機械裝置的一面大約是四毫米長，非常微小。
paragraphs.en: So one of the bigcontributions from my lab has been to combinerigid and soft materials in very, very small mechanisms. So this jumping mechanismis about four millimeters on a side, so really tiny.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 此處使用的硬材料是矽，軟材料則是矽膠。這背後基本的想法就是我們要壓縮這一塊然後在彈簧中儲存能量再釋放，讓它跳躍起來。
paragraphs.en: The hard material here is silicon,and the soft material is silicone rubber. And the basic idea is thatwe're going to compress this, store energy in the springs,and then release it to jump.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以現在這塊板上沒有馬達和電源。而這一裝置的實現原理在我的實驗室中被稱為“拿著鑷子的研究生”（笑）所以，你將在下一條影片中看到的是這個跳躍能力很出色的小傢伙。
paragraphs.en: So there's no motorson board this right now, no power. This is actuated with a methodthat we call in my lab "graduate student with tweezers." So what you'll see in the next video is this guy doingamazingly well for its jumps.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這位是艾倫，那個拿著鑷子的研究生，而你將看到的是這個四毫米長的機械裝置跳躍到幾乎40釐米的高度。大約是它自己長度的100倍。
paragraphs.en: So this is Aaron, the graduate studentin question, with the tweezers, and what you see is this four-millimeter-sized mechanism jumping almost 40 centimeters high. That's almost 100 times its own length.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 而且它倖存了下來，在桌面上彈跳著，十分強大，並且存活得很好，直到我們找不到它的时候，因為它實在太小了。不過我們最終還是想要在這個裝置中加上馬達，而我們的實驗室裡也有學生正在研究毫米尺寸的馬達以最終將它裝到小型的自動機器人身上
paragraphs.en: And it survives, bounces on the table, it's incredibly robust, and of coursesurvives quite well until we lose it because it's very tiny. Ultimately, though, we wantto add motors to this too, and we have students in the labworking on millimeter-sized motors to eventually integrate ontosmall, autonomous robots.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但是為了觀察如此微小的裝置的機動性和移動能力，我們“作弊”並使用了磁鐵。這條影片展現了最终將會成為微型機器人的腿的那一部份，而你可以看到矽膠製成的接合點以及一塊被外在磁場控制而四处移動的嵌入式磁鐵。
paragraphs.en: But in order to look at mobility andlocomotion at this size scale to start, we're cheating and using magnets. So this shows what would eventuallybe part of a micro-robot leg, and you can see the silicone rubber joints and there's an embedded magnetthat's being moved around by an external magnetic field.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這就引向了我之前為大家展示的那個機器人。真正有趣的是，這個機器人能帮助我們弄清楚這樣規模的昆蟲是如何移動的。
paragraphs.en: So this leads to the robotthat I showed you earlier. The really interesting thingthat this robot can help us figure out is how insects move at this scale.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我們有一個很棒的模型來理解所有大小事物的移動方式，小到一隻蟑螂，大到一隻大象。跑步時，我們都以這種彈跳的方式移動。
paragraphs.en: We have a really good modelfor how everything from a cockroach up to an elephant moves. We all move in this kind of bouncy way when we run.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但是當我的體型十分微小時，我雙腳和地面之間的力量會大大影響我的移動，遠大於影響我的質量，從而就造成了彈跳模式。這個小傢伙還沒能完全正常運作但是我們還有稍大些能夠四處奔跑的版本。
paragraphs.en: But when I'm really small, the forces between my feet and the ground are going to affect my locomotiona lot more than my mass, which is what causes that bouncy motion. So this guy doesn't work quite yet, but we do have slightly larger versionsthat do run around.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這大約是一立方釐米，每一邊都為一釐米，非常微小，而我們讓它能夠以每秒十個身長的速度奔跑，也就是每秒10釐米的速度。對於這麼小的傢伙來說是非常快了，而這還僅僅侷限於我們的測試設置。
paragraphs.en: So this is about a centimeter cubed,a centimeter on a side, so very tiny, and we've gotten this to runabout 10 body lengths per second, so 10 centimeters per second. It's pretty quick for a little, small guy, and that's really only limited by our test setup.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但現在這能讓你了解它是如何運作的了。我們也可以製作它的3D打印模型，可以跨越障礙物的模型，十分像你們之前看到過的蟑螂。
paragraphs.en: But this gives you some ideaof how it works right now. We can also make 3D-printed versions of this that can climb over obstacles, a lot like the cockroachthat you saw earlier.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 但是最終我們希望能把所有部件都安置到機器人身上。我們想讓感應、電源、操控和驅動一同實現，並且不是所有部件都需要是仿生的。
paragraphs.en: But ultimately we want to addeverything onboard the robot. We want sensing, power, control,actuation all together, and not everythingneeds to be bio-inspired.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 而這個機器人差不多是指針大小。在這種情況下，我們並沒有用磁鐵或肌肉，而是火箭裝置來使它移動。
paragraphs.en: So this robot's aboutthe size of a Tic Tac. And in this case, instead of magnetsor muscles to move this around, we use rockets.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 這是一片微加工的含能材料，而我們能製造它的微觀像素，然後將一塊像素放到這個機器人的腹部，當這個機器人感應到光源增加時，就會跳躍。下一條短片是我的最愛。
paragraphs.en: So this is a micro-fabricatedenergetic material, and we can create tiny pixels of this, and we can put one of these pixelson the belly of this robot, and this robot, then, is going to jumpwhen it senses an increase in light. So the next video is one of my favorites.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 你能看到這隻300毫克的機器人在空中跳躍到大概8釐米高。但它只有4＊4＊7立方毫米的體積。
paragraphs.en: So you have this 300-milligram robot jumping about eightcentimeters in the air. It's only four by fourby seven millimeters in size.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 在短片的開頭，能看到當能量被釋放時，有一道大閃光，而機器人就在空中翻跟鬥所以此時就有一大道閃光，然後你就可以看到機器人在空中翻跟鬥。
paragraphs.en: And you'll see a big flashat the beginning when the energetic is set off, and the robot tumbling through the air. So there was that big flash, and you can see the robotjumping up through the air.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 而這個機器人的身上沒有栓繩或連接電線，所有的部件都安裝到位了，當旁邊的一個學生打開了桌面檯燈時，機器人就會受到感應，跳躍起來。
paragraphs.en: So there's no tethers on this,no wires connecting to this. Everything is onboard,and it jumped in response to the student just flicking ona desk lamp next to it.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 因此我想你能想像到我們用這樣尺寸的，會跑、會怕、會跳、會滾的機器人，所能做到的很多很酷的事情。想像一下一場自然災害，如地震發生之後，產生的諸多碎石。
paragraphs.en: So I think you can imagineall the cool things that we could do with robots that can run and crawland jump and roll at this size scale. Imagine the rubble that you get after a natural disaster like an earthquake.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 想像一下這些微型機器人穿越過碎石來尋找倖存者。或想像一下許多微型機器人跑過一座橋，檢閱橋的質量，保證它的安全性，因而不至於造成發生在2007年，明尼阿波利斯市的橋體坍塌事件。
paragraphs.en: Imagine these small robotsrunning through that rubble to look for survivors. Or imagine a lot of small robotsrunning around a bridge in order to inspect itand make sure it's safe so you don't get collapses like this, which happened outside of Minneapolis in 2007.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 或者就想像一下當這樣的機器人游過你的血液時的樣子。是吧？正如艾薩克·阿西莫夫在《神奇的旅程》中所描述的一樣。
paragraphs.en: Or just imagine what you could do if you had robots that couldswim through your blood. Right? "Fantastic Voyage," Isaac Asimov.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 然後醫生們從一開始就不需要開腹，也能進行手術了。又或許我們能夠讓微型機器人像白蟻一般工作，從而徹底改變我們建造事物的方式，而他們能夠在非洲和澳洲，為其他白蟻建造難以置信的，高效率通風的八米高的土堆。
paragraphs.en: Or they could operate without havingto cut you open in the first place. Or we could radically changethe way we build things if we have our tiny robotswork the same way that termites do, and they build these incredibleeight-meter-high mounds, effectively well ventilatedapartment buildings for other termites in Africa and Australia.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以我認為我已經向各位展示了利用這些微型機器人，所能實現的許多可能性。而迄今為止我們也取得了一些進步，但仍有很長的路要走，希望你們當中也有人能夠為此做出貢獻。
paragraphs.en: So I think I've given yousome of the possibilities of what we can do with these small robots. And we've made some advances so far,but there's still a long way to go, and hopefully some of youcan contribute to that destination.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 非常感謝。
paragraphs.en: Thanks very much.

title: Sarah Bergbreiter Why I Make Robots The Size Of A Grain Of Rice
